latest news.eng_title: Antony Blinken ends latest Mideast visit without a cease-fire, warning 'time is of the essence'
latest news.summary: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken ended his ninth visit to the Middle East without securing a cease-fire deal, warning that 'time is of the essence.' Blinken said that Israel has accepted a proposal to bridge gaps with Hamas, but the focus now is on getting Hamas on board. He emphasized that 'our message is simple. It's clear and it's urgent. We need to get a cease-fire and hostage agreement over the finish line, and we need to do it now.' The recent targeted killings of militant leaders and vows of retaliation have added urgency to the situation, and wide gaps remain between Israel and Hamas. Jonathan Panikoff, director of the Scowcroft Middle East Security Initiative, said that 'Americans have little alternative to continuing to push Israel and Hamas to agree to a negotiated end to fighting, but it's fundamentally about Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, who helped mastermind the October 7, 2023 attacks.' The recovery of the bodies of six hostages taken in Hamas' October 7, 2023 attack has brought fresh grief for many Israelis, and new protests were held on Tuesday. 'The longer they're there, the more body bags we get,' said one protester, Adi Israeli, in Tel Aviv.
latest news.title: Antony Blinken ends latest Mideast visit without a cease-fire, warning 'time is of the essence'

latest news.eng_title: Hamas Rejects Israel's Ceasefire Plan, Citing Loss of Power in Gaza
latest news.summary: Hamas has labeled Israel's proposed ceasefire plan as a 'coup d'etat'. The Palestinian delegation from the Gaza Strip did not attend the Doha meetings, leaving it up to Qatar, one of the mediators. Hamas wants to return to the July 2 plan, proposed by Joe Biden, which was suspended after Israel assassinated a Hamas military leader in Gaza and then, in Tehran (Iran), its leader Ismail Haniyeh. The proposed plan had several stages and included minimum demands from both Israel and Hamas. However, Hamas has a problem with the plan, as it would require them to 'vacate authority' and allow the Palestinian Authority to govern in the Gaza Strip. Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar also has another problem, as Israel accuses him of being the mastermind behind the October 7 attack and considers him a 'dead man'. Antony Blinken said that Israel is finally willing to agree to a truce, but Hamas must do the same. The situation is complex, and Blinken is still negotiating in Doha to avoid a military intervention by Iran and to prevent the conflict from escalating.
latest news.title: Por qué Hamas calificó de 'golpe de Estado' la propuesta de Israel para el cese del fuego

latest news.eng_title: Negotiate hard, watch Sinwar back down
latest news.summary: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken is working to secure a cease-fire in Gaza and the release of hostages, but his approach may lead to the opposite outcome. Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar is unlikely to give up the hostages without concessions, such as a permanent cease-fire and the withdrawal of IDF forces from Gaza. Sinwar's leverage is increased by the fact that Iran and Hezbollah have said they would agree to a cease-fire if he does. To shift the balance of power, a war between Iran, Hezbollah, and Israel could destabilize the region and force Israel to reach a deal. The US must declare its readiness to exact a heavy price from Iran if it attacks Israel, convincing Sinwar that he has no military backing and will be left to his own devices. Only then will he be willing to agree to a limited cease-fire and release hostages.
latest news.title: Negotiate hard, watch Sinwar back down

latest news.eng_title: A new leader for the next phase of Palestinian resistance
latest news.summary: The Palestinian Islamic Resistance Movement, Hamas, has elected Yahya Sinwar as its new head of the Political Bureau, succeeding Ismail Haniyeh who was assassinated in an Israeli terrorist attack. Sinwar, known as Abu Ibrahim, is a prominent figure in the Hamas political sphere, known for his heavy hand and ability to make big changes. His unanimous election is a strong message that Hamas has become stronger and more resilient despite the severe blow it received from Haniyeh's assassination. Sinwar has played a crucial role in shaping the resistance movement's strategies and managing Gaza's complex political and social relations. He has been elected head of the Hamas Political Bureau in Gaza twice, in 2017 and 2021, and has led several key campaigns, including the Great March of Return and the Sword of Al-Quds campaign. He has also strengthened relations with the axis of resistance. Sinwar was born in 1962 in the Khan Younis refugee camp in the Gaza Strip and began his political activity in his youth, leading numerous popular clashes against the Zionist occupation state. He was arrested by Israel multiple times and spent 23 consecutive years in the enemy's prisons, where he assumed leadership of the Hamas prisoners' High Command and led several hunger strikes. He was released in 2011 under a prisoner exchange deal and has since assumed various leadership roles within Hamas.
latest news.title: A new leader for the next phase of Palestinian resistance

latest news.eng_title: Hamas's Strategic Mistake: The Selection of Yahya Sinwar
latest news.summary: The selection of Yahya Sinwar, a known 'madman', as the new leader of Hamas's political bureau has sparked controversy. The move is seen as a strategic mistake by many experts, as Sinwar is a militant leader who lacks the ability to lead the organization politically. He is also a target for Israeli forces and will be unable to leave Gaza safely. The selection of Sinwar is seen as a way to avoid internal divisions and external pressure, but it may ultimately harm the organization's chances of survival. Hamas's goal is to prove its unity and ability to make decisions, but the selection of Sinwar may be seen as a sign of weakness. The organization's leaders may have chosen Sinwar to appear strong and defiant in the face of Israeli pressure, but this may ultimately backfire. The selection of Sinwar is a complex issue, and its implications for Hamas's future are unclear.
latest news.title: اختيار السنوار ومستقبل"حماس الإرهابية"

latest news.eng_title: Hamas: Sinwar's Decisions are in Line with the Negotiation Process
keywords: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken
latest news.summary: Osama Hamdan, a senior Hamas official, stated that the movement's new leader, Yahya Sinwar, was 'in line with the negotiation process (related to the ceasefire agreement in Gaza) and was a partner in making decisions related to it.' Hamdan added that the communication with Sinwar 'has its tools and mechanisms, and of course, the security conditions leave a mark on our desire not to target Sinwar, but these contacts are taking place in a smooth and satisfactory manner and achieving the goal.' US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said during a press conference in Tel Aviv that 'Israel has accepted the proposal to bridge the gaps and supports it.' However, Hamdan criticized Blinken's statement, saying that it 'raises many ambiguities' because 'it is not the paper that was presented to us and not the one that Hamas agreed to.' The US is expected to restart the negotiations this week based on a proposal to bridge the gaps between Hamas and Israel. The visit comes as President Joe Biden faces increasing pressure in the elections due to his stance on the conflict. The Democratic Party is holding its national convention on Monday amidst protests in support of Palestinians and concerns about the votes of Muslim and Arab Americans in the swing states.
latest news.title: حماس: قرارات واتصالات السنوار تجري بطريقة سلسة

latest news.eng_title: Hamas: Blinken's Statement on 'New Proposal' Raises Confusion
latest news.summary: Hamas leader Osama Hamdan stated that 'there is no need for new negotiations to stop the war in Gaza, but rather to agree on a mechanism to implement the current agreement.' Hamdan added that 'Blinken says that Netanyahu has accepted a new proposal that raises a lot of confusion, as it is not what we were offered or what we agreed on.' Hamdan emphasized that 'Netanyahu's statement that he has accepted a new proposal means that the US administration has failed to convince him to agree.' He also stated that 'the mediators will inform Blinken that Hamas respects its commitments and what it agreed on on July 2.' Hamdan noted that 'everything the American side is doing is just buying time to continue the genocide in Gaza.' Meanwhile, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said that the US is working with all countries to convey a message to avoid escalation in the Middle East. He added that 'everyone should avoid taking steps or actions that increase tension and expand the scope of violence... and the best way to achieve a lasting ceasefire in Gaza is to release the hostages.' Blinken stated that 'Netanyahu has confirmed to me that Israel has accepted the proposal, and it is now up to Hamas to accept it.' He also mentioned that 'experts will work on providing a clear understanding of the implementation of the agreement in the coming days.'
latest news.title: حماس: حديث بلينكن عن "مقترح محدث" يثير الكثير من الغموض ...مصر

latest news.eng_title: Hamas Leader Considers Latest Gaza Negotiations a 'Bluff'
latest news.summary: Yahya Sinwar, the head of the Hamas political bureau, considers the latest round of negotiations to cease hostilities in the Gaza Strip as a 'bluff' aimed at giving Israel time to conduct a military campaign, according to the Wall Street Journal, citing Arab mediators. Sinwar believes that the negotiations are a 'bluff' aimed at gaining additional time for Israel to conduct its military campaign, the publication said. In addition, Sinwar plans to increase pressure on Israel by expanding the armed conflict, including through attacks from the West Bank, the Journal reported. Meanwhile, the office of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu stated that he continues to work on advancing a deal for the Gaza Strip, which would maximize the number of released hostages and ensure that the Israeli Defense Forces remain in the buffer zone on the border with the Gaza Strip and Egypt. Last week, negotiations on a ceasefire in the Gaza Strip took place in Doha, with the participation of Qatar, Egypt, the United States, and Israel. Hamas leadership refused to participate in the negotiations due to the lack of specificity in the terms of the ceasefire. A joint statement by the United States, Qatar, and Egypt, published by the office of Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, stated that the mediators presented a proposal for a ceasefire to Israel and the Hamas movement, which reduces the differences between the two sides. According to the statement, the negotiations, which took place on Thursday and Friday in Doha, were serious and constructive and took place in a positive atmosphere.
latest news.title: Глава ХАМАС считает переговоры по Газе блефом, пишут СМИ

latest news.eng_title: Hamas Leader Yahya Sinwar Continues to Support Ceasefire Negotiations in Gaza
latest news.summary: According to a Hamas leader, Yahya Sinwar, the new leader of the movement, has been following the process of negotiations for a ceasefire in Gaza and has been supportive of it. The leader, Hamdan, stated in an interview with Reuters that 'the communication with Sinwar has its tools and mechanisms, and of course, the security conditions leave a mark on our desire not to harm Sinwar, but these contacts are done in a smooth and satisfactory way and achieve the goal.' Hamdan also criticized US Secretary of State Antony Blinken's statement that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu had presented a new proposal, saying it 'raises many ambiguities' because 'it is not the paper we were given and not the one that Hamas agreed to.' Hamdan revealed that Hamas has already confirmed to mediators that it does not need 'new negotiations or new ideas, there is a proposal that we have agreed on and we need to implement it, which is based on President Joe Biden's proposal as well.'
latest news.title: السنوار يواكب عمليّة التفاوض لوقف إطلاق النار في غزة... كيف يتم التواصل معه؟

latest news.eng_title: Hamas Rejects New Negotiations, Sticking to Existing Proposal
latest news.summary: Osama Hamdan, a leader in Hamas, criticized US Secretary of State Antony Blinken's statement that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu made a new proposal for a ceasefire in Gaza. Hamdan said that the proposal 'raises many questions' because 'it is not the paper we were given and it is not the one that Hamas agreed to'. Hamdan told Reuters that Hamas has already confirmed to mediators that it does not need 'new negotiations or new ideas, there is a proposal that we agreed to and we need to implement it, which is also based on President Joe Biden's proposal'. Hamdan also said that 'the communication with the UN is done in a smooth and satisfactory way and achieves the goal'. He added that 'the UN was a follower of the negotiation process, a supporter of it, and a partner in making decisions related to it'.
latest news.title: حماس لا تحتاج إلى مفاوضات جديدة

news knowledge.eng_title: Hamas Appoints Terrorist Leader as Chairman of 'Political Bureau'
news knowledge.summary: Hamas has appointed Yahya Sinwar, the mastermind behind the 7 October 2023 attacks on thousands of Israelis, as the chairman of its 'political bureau'. This move shows that Hamas' political and military branches are the same, and that there is no difference between a political and military leader in an Islamist terrorist organization. Sinwar's appointment has sparked concerns that Western media will again label him as 'moderate' and 'pragmatic', despite his history of violence and terrorism. Hamas' leaders, including Sinwar, have repeatedly called for the destruction of Israel and the murder of Jews, and have been involved in numerous terrorist attacks. The article questions whether Western governments will continue to engage with Hamas and its leaders, despite their extremist views and violent actions. 'What is a 'very moderate leader' of an Islamist jihadist death cult that carried out the deadliest terrorist attack since 9/11?' asked Elon Levy, a former Israeli government spokesperson. 'For the BBC, Ismail Haniyeh was 'moderate and pragmatic'; for the rest of us, he was a monster,' said Stephen Pollard, a British author and journalist. 'Haniyeh was indeed 'moderate'. The total number of Jews murdered by Hamas is not even close to six million. Not that Haniyeh would have seen that as anything other than disappointing, given that he led an organization determined to wipe every Jew off the face of the earth.'
news knowledge.title: Hamas-'politici' en -terroristen: Geen verschil tussen hen

news knowledge.eng_title: Qatari Journalists Celebrate Yahya Sinwar's Appointment As Hamas' New Political Bureau Chairman, Calling Him 'The Hero Of October 7,' 'The Saladin Of Our Century' And 'Israel's Nightmare'
news knowledge.summary: Qatari journalists celebrated the appointment of Yahya Sinwar as the new chairman of Hamas' political bureau, calling him 'the hero of October 7,' 'the Saladin of our century,' and 'Israel's nightmare.' They praised Hamas for making the 'correct' decision and mocked Israel for killing the more accommodating Haniya and getting the hardliner Sinwar instead. Journalists and Al-Jazeera hosts shared posts on X, congratulating Sinwar and wishing him success, with some even sharing images of Sinwar drawing a gun and writing that he is a 'leader in the spirit of the Prophet's companions.' They expressed pride in Sinwar and called him an 'honorable model' of leadership that the Islamic nation sorely needs. Some even wrote that Sinwar's appointment is a 'blow to Israel' and that Netanyahu will face 'death' with Sinwar as the head of Hamas' political bureau.
news knowledge.title: Qatari Journalists Celebrate Yahya Sinwar's Appointment As Hamas' New Political Bureau Chairman, Calling Him 'The Hero Of October 7,' 'The Saladin Of Our Century' And 'Israel's Nightmare'

news knowledge.eng_title: Hamas' New Leader: A Challenge to Israel

Organization: Arab Centre for Research and Policy Studies

news knowledge.summary: The nomination of Yahya Sinwar as the new leader of the Hamas' political bureau is seen as a challenge to Israel. Sinwar, considered the main instigator of the October 7 attack, has been on the run for 10 months, evading the Israeli army in the tunnels of Gaza. According to Leïla Seurat, a specialist on Hamas, the choice of Sinwar was imposed due to Israel's brutal war and the rejection of negotiations. Seurat, a researcher at the Arab Centre for Research and Policy Studies in Paris and author of 'Hamas and the World', says that the message from Hamas to Israel is that the organization is 'ready for confrontation'. It is unclear whether Sinwar's appointment was a consensual decision or if he imposed himself, but it was necessary to replace Haniyeh quickly, avoiding the internal elections scheduled for spring 2025.
news knowledge.title: «La nomination de Yahya Sinwar prouve que le pouvoir au sein du Hamas est passé clairement à Gaza»

news knowledge.eng_title: Israel Condemns Hamas's New Leader Yahya Sinwar
news knowledge.summary: Israel's Foreign Minister Yisrael Katz called Hamas Political Bureau Chairman Yahya Sinwar 'the main terrorist' after he was appointed as the new leader of Hamas following the assassination of Ismail Heniyye. Katz said, 'The appointment of Yahya Sinwar, the main terrorist, as the new leader of Hamas, is another reason to eliminate him and eradicate this despicable organization.' The Israeli state television KAN reported that Sinwar's appointment was a 'surprise' and sent a message to Israel that Hamas leadership is still strong, as Sinwar, who is considered the main responsible for the 7 October Aksa Tufan operation, is still alive. KAN's Arab Affairs and Middle East Correspondent Roi Kais said that Sinwar's appointment was a 'surprise' and that it sent a message to Israel that Hamas leadership is still strong and in control. Ehud Yaari, a Middle East analyst for Channel 12, said that Sinwar's appointment was a 'practical move' to confirm his position within Hamas. Sinwar was previously the Political Bureau Chairman of Hamas in Gaza.
news knowledge.title: İsrail'den Yahya Sinvar açıklaması: 7 Ekim'in bir numaralı sorumlusu tutulmuştu!

news knowledge.eng_title: Hamas Appoints Yahya Sinwar as New Head of Political Bureau
news knowledge.summary: Hamas has appointed Yahya Sinwar as the new head of its political bureau, replacing Ismail Haniyeh who was assassinated. This move is seen as a strong message to Israel that the leadership of Hamas is still strong and united. Sinwar, the mastermind behind the 'Great March of Return' attack, faces challenges in communicating with the rest of the leadership. Israeli Foreign Minister Yair Lapid called for Sinwar's swift elimination, considering the appointment a reason to do so. Hamas has received support from Hezbollah, with the party stating that the appointment is a strong message to the Israeli enemy. The leadership of Hamas has emphasized its unity and determination to resist Israeli provocation. Sinwar was previously elected as the head of Hamas in Gaza in 2017 and re-elected in 2021. He has been a target for Israeli assassination attempts since the outbreak of the war in Gaza in October 2023.
news knowledge.title: تعيين السنوار خلفاً لهنية يفاجئ إسرائيل: قيادة الحركة لا تزال قوية

news knowledge.eng_title: Hamas announces Yahya Sinwar as new Chief of Political Bureau
news knowledge.summary: Hamas has announced Yahya Sinwar as its new Chief of Political Bureau, replacing Ismail Haniyeh who was killed in a strike in Tehran last month. According to a statement from the group, Sinwar's selection is a 'strong message to the occupation that Hamas continues its path of resistance.' A senior Hamas official stated, 'The assassination of Haniyeh, who believed in reaching a ceasefire agreement and a prisoner exchange deal, leads Hamas to choose a leader who manages the battle and resistance against the enemy.' Israel has accused Sinwar of being one of the masterminds of the October 7 attack last year and has called for his 'swift elimination.' Israeli Foreign Minister Israel Katz stated, 'The appointment of arch-terrorist Yahya Sinwar as the new leader of Hamas, replacing Ismail Haniyeh, is yet another compelling reason to swiftly eliminate him and wipe this vile organisation off the face of the Earth.'
news knowledge.title: Hamas announces Yahya Sinwar as new Chief of Political Bureau

news knowledge.eng_title: Hamas Chooses Yahya Sinwar as New Head of Political Bureau
news knowledge.summary: Hamas announced yesterday that Yahya Sinwar has been chosen as the new head of the movement's political bureau, succeeding the late Ismail Haniyeh. Sinwar, born in 1962 in the Gaza Strip, has been arrested multiple times by Israel and was sentenced to four life terms in prison before being released in a prisoner exchange deal in 2011. He returned to his role as the head of the 'Kataeb al-Qassam' (the military wing of Hamas) and was elected as the head of Hamas in the Gaza Strip in 2017 and again in 2021. Israel considers Sinwar responsible for the 'Tufan al-Aqsa' operation on October 7, 2023, and has stated that his elimination is one of the goals of its aggression on the Gaza Strip.
news knowledge.title: «حماس» تختار يحيى السنوار رئيساً

news knowledge.eng_title: Hamas Leader Yahya Sinwar's Rise to Power Amid Escalating Tensions
news knowledge.summary: Following the assassination of Hamas Political Bureau Chairman Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran, tensions have escalated in the Middle East. Hamas has announced the selection of Yahya Sinwar as the new Political Bureau Chairman. According to a statement on Hamas's Telegram account, 'Hamas announces the selection of Commander Yahya Sinwar as the new Political Bureau Chairman in place of the martyr leader Ismail Haniyeh.' Sinwar is known for his aggressive stance and is believed to be behind the 7 October attacks. Despite Israel offering a $400,000 reward for his capture, Sinwar has not been killed. Sinwar, the founder of Hamas's Security Organization, has been arrested three times but was released due to Hamas- Israel negotiations. He has since risen through the ranks of Hamas and has been the political leader in Gaza since 2017. The US added him to the list of international terrorists in 2015. Haniyeh was in Tehran for the inauguration of the new Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi when he was assassinated. Iran and Hamas blamed Israel for the attack, while Israeli officials remained silent. Hamas described the event as 'a significant and dangerous development that will take the war to new dimensions across the region.'
news knowledge.title: Hamas lideri Yahya Sinvar'ın başına ödül var! ABD kara listede tutuyor

news knowledge.eng_title: Yahya Sinwar Elected as New Hamas Political Bureau Chairman
news knowledge.summary: Following the assassination of Hamas Political Bureau Chairman Ismail Haniyye in Tehran, the new leader of Hamas has been announced. According to a statement by Hamas, 'Yahya Sinwar, our leader in Gaza, has been elected as the new Political Bureau Chairman.' Sinwar, the founder of the 'Mecd' Hamas security service, which is responsible for internal security, investigating suspected Israeli agents, and tracking Israeli intelligence officers, has been a hardline figure. He was arrested three times but was released due to Hamas- Israel negotiations. Sinwar has been the political leader of the Gaza Strip since 2017, taking over the position from Haniye. 'It is a testament to the dedication and resilience of our people,' said Sinwar, 'that we have overcome this difficult time and emerged stronger than ever.'
news knowledge.title: Hamas'ın yeni Başkanı Yahya Sinvar oldu! Uzun süre İsrail hapishanesinde kalıp 2011'de serbest kalmıştı

news knowledge.eng_title: Hamas Leader Yahya Sinwar Opposes Khaled Meshaal's Transition to Political Bureau Chairman
news knowledge.summary: According to Saudi Arabian media, Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar is opposing the transition of Hamas Political Bureau Chairman position to Khaled Meshaal. The position has been vacant since the assassination of Ismail Haniya, the previous chairman. Al Hadath, a Saudi Arabian television channel, reported that Sinwar prefers someone with stronger ties to Iran over Meshaal, who is considered a favorite for the position. It was also mentioned that Hamas leaders met in Qatar yesterday and Sinwar conveyed his preference. Meshaal and Halil el-Hayya are being considered as the top candidates to replace Haniya, with el-Hayya being a strong figure within Hamas. The final decision will be made by the Shura Council, a consultative body consisting of political, religious, and other figures.
news knowledge.title: Hamas lideri Sinwar, Halid Meşal'in Hamas Siyasi Büro Başkanlığına geçmesine karşı çıkıyor
